citations.narrative:
On July 11, 2024, a black vulture escaped from the facility while being placed into a transport enclosure in an outdoor
area located immediately adjacent to the outdoor portion of vulture’s primary enclosure. The vulture escaped from the
transport enclosure before the transport enclosure door could be closed and was never recaptured.
Birds that escape are at increased risk of disease and injury. Furthermore, birds that escape their enclosure may have
limited access to food, water, and shelter.
Handling of all animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating,
excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Handling must also be conducted in a
way that prevents escape.
Corrected at the time of inspection (October 16th, 2024).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1)  Critical
   
Miscellaneous. 
On July 11, 2024, a black vulture escaped from the facility while being placed into a transport enclosure in an outdoor 
area located immediately adjacent to the outdoor portion of vulture’s primary enclosure. The vulture escaped from the 
transport enclosure before the transport enclosure door could be closed and was never recaptured.  
 
Birds that escape are at increased risk of disease and injury. Furthermore, birds that escape their enclosure may have 
limited access to food, water, and shelter. 
 
Handling of all animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, 
excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. Handling must also be conducted in a 
way that prevents escape. 
 
Corrected at the time of inspection (October 16th, 2024). 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
